Uses of Class
functions.Function

  • Packages that use Function 
    Package Description
    application
    this package contains the code for the GUI, which uses the other two packages
    functions
    This package contains all classes nessecary, to work with mathematical functions, with the most important class being Function
    stringConverter
    This package contains all the stuff needed to convert a String to a Function

    • Uses of Function in functions

      Methods in functions that return Function 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Function Function.getAntiderivative()
      Calculates the antiderivative, if the function is not to complex.
      Function Function.getDerivative()
      Calculates the first derivative.
      Function Function.getDerivative​(int n)
      calculates the n-th derivative.
      static Function Function.load​(java.lang.String filepath)
      Loads a function from a existing .func file
      Methods in functions with parameters of type Function 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      private double Function.calculateIntegral​(Function antiderivative, Interval interval)
      Utility function calculating surface parts.
      double Function.calculateSurface​(Interval interval, Function function)
      Calculates the surface between the curve and the x- axis

      can be stopped trough Thread.interrupt()
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> Function.newtonMethod​(Interval interval, double epsilon, Function function)
      Calculates the zeros with the newton Method

      can be stopped trough Thread.interrupt()
      static void Function.save​(java.lang.String filepath, Function function)
      Stores the function in a .func file

    • Uses of Function in stringConverter

      Methods in stringConverter that return Function 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static Function FunctionBuilder.stringToFunction​(java.lang.String functionTerm)
      Uses FunctionBuilder.stringToFunction(String, String, String) to convert the input to a Function
      It trys to find out the variable, and function name from the String, otherwise it will just use the following defaults:
      functionName = "f" variableName = "x" These will be resolved from the following form:
      "functionName(variableName) = ..."
      static Function FunctionBuilder.stringToFunction​(java.lang.String functionTerm, java.lang.String variableName, java.lang.String functionName)
      Converts a String to a Function.
